alert.note: Alert for Morgan County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 05 at 4:51PM MST until January 06 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Fort Morgan, and Akron. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 8 AM MST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen. Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Roads will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. If you go outside, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org
